intro: Duguetia staudtii, commonly known as the red-flowered tree, is a species of flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil, Colombia, and Peru. The plant is characterized by its striking red flowers, which are typically clustered in inflorescences at the ends of branches. Duguetia staudtii is a small to medium-sized tree that can grow up to 10 meters in height, with smooth, pale bark and elliptical leaves. It is often found in moist, shaded habitats within tropical rainforests.
